stream_context.summary: Kaze models and codes an ice-themed castle area (mainly Course 3), fixes rendering bugs, rewrites the mirror system, and benchmarks micro-code performance while discussing release and emulator strategies.

development_findings.summary: Replaced the old hard-coded mirror setup with a flag-based 8-byte struct (axis + ranges) making new mirrors trivial to add and cheaper to process.
development_findings.quote: Dude, this is gonna be the easiest system to add new mirrors ever.

development_findings.summary: A lighting bug introduced after X3 migration causes ambient colour to drop to 0 whenever a second light source (e.g., a star) spawns; root cause still unknown.
development_findings.quote: If a second light source appears like the star over there Mario’s colours just go dark – the ambient just resets to zero.

development_findings.summary: RSP, not RDP, is now the main bottleneck; X3 micro-code raises Course 1 from 46 FPS to ~60, so per-level memory and micro-code tuning is planned.
development_findings.quote: We found out that the bottleneck is actually the RSP and not the RDP.

development_findings.summary: Entire castle currently renders at once; moving geometry into ‘rooms’ and culling doors guarantees future 60 FPS and lower cost effects.
development_findings.quote: The thing about this level here is that everything is in rooms … which means that this is basically guaranteed 60 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Plans to adopt tri-strips / tri-fans once GlideN64 supports them, possibly dropping generic emulator support to squeeze maximal N64 speed.
development_findings.quote: Supporting emulators makes the entire game run slower … after 1.1 I might ditch emulator support entirely unless GlideN64 handles it.

development_findings.summary: Legal release plan: distribute only a patch file; v1 demo is Course 1, v1.1 adds bug-fixes, later versions may become N64-only.
development_findings.quote: I will release a patch that will contain only my own changes … Version 1 is emulator + N64, after that I want the game to run as well on N64 as it can.

development_findings.summary: Custom per-level memory allocator and collision pool sizes are being tuned to avoid node overflows in large areas.
development_findings.quote: Yeah, I made my own memory allocator. I should probably just have an accept list; this only runs on level loads so I don’t care about the three microseconds.

development_findings.summary: Shading errors traced to emulator-only code that copies X2 light structs instead of X3; works correctly on console hardware.
development_findings.quote: Something’s really messed up here … but it looks perfect on X3 when I run it on the actual N64.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is balancing a full-time job, a newborn child, and development; streams more often to increase income.
context_findings.quote: I have a child now and I need more money, so hopefully there will be more streams.

context_findings.summary: Experienced a sophisticated Web3 sponsorship scam attempt and reported it to anti-scam researchers.
context_findings.quote: I’m not downloading an exe ever … the GitHub belonged to someone working in anti-scam software; now they’re tracking who tried to spear-phish me.

context_findings.summary: Holds a playful, dismissive stance on language wars—believes good programmers shouldn’t care much about C++ vs. Rust vs. Python.
context_findings.quote: If you care at all which programming language you use, that is a very strong indicator that you’re a terrible programmer.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration and curiosity over technical bugs but genuine excitement when breakthroughs (like mirror fix) occur.
Mentions donation alert system is broken and wants to properly credit an anonymous donor.
context_findings.quote: Someone donated 50 € twice and I would like to give him a shout-out, but the alert isn’t firing.

biobak.summary: Insists on perfectly squared texture tiling; Kaze adjusts geometry to avoid Biobak’s ‘wrath’.
biobak.quote: It’s going to be that case: ‘Why didn’t you make it perfect squares? Fix it now while you can before the wrath of Biobak murders me.’

zeina.summary: Present in chat, offers light-hearted support; no direct development input this stream.

key_stories.title: The Web3 Sponsorship Scam
key_stories.summary: A convincing advertiser asked Kaze to run an unfamiliar executable to join a ‘Web3 teaching’ call. Suspicious, Kaze refused, confirmed the identity was stolen from a GitHub anti-scam expert, and helped start an investigation.
key_stories.challenge: Determine if the sponsorship offer was legitimate.
key_stories.process: Refused to run the executable, checked the Zoom URL, contacted the real GitHub owner.
key_stories.outcome: Turned evidence over to anti-scam professionals who are tracing the perpetrators.
key_stories.key_quote: I’m not downloading an exe file ever, no matter how legit this looks.

key_stories.title: Mystery of the Vanishing Ambient Light
key_stories.summary: Ever since switching to X3, adding a second light makes Mario go completely dark. Kaze spends part of the stream hunting the cause but leaves it unresolved.
key_stories.challenge: Ambient colour resets to zero with multiple light sources.
key_stories.process: Tested in emulator vs. console, inspected light structs, confirmed console works, emulator doesn’t.
key_stories.key_quote: Something’s really messed up here; it actually gets darker when I get close to the thing.

key_stories.title: Mirror System Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Old, hard-coded mirror definitions were difficult to edit. Kaze designs a new axis-flag system, updates data, fixes axis mix-ups, and validates on hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Make mirrors easier to define and cheaper to compute.
key_stories.process: Designed new 8-byte struct, refactored code, corrected axis confusion, removed scale bone issues.
key_stories.outcome: Mirrors now work across multiple rooms; future additions will be straightforward.
key_stories.key_quote: This is gonna be the easiest system to add new mirrors ever.
